intro: Randia oppositifolia var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by small, round berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
